Данная игра при своём выходе была шикарна  по всем параметрам, но теперь по этим параметрам спустя 22 года она во много в чём уступает,  но всё же игра прикольная и интересная. 非常經典的神作，值得買來收藏。

扮演遊戲中精通各式槍械的科學家，高登弗里曼，因實驗中出差錯造成外星生物入侵，被政府以造成此次事件的元兇，並連帶所有成員與外星生物進行殲滅行動。
弗里曼現在不止要盡力拯救路上遇到會開門的科學家、保全，更要與軍隊對抗，並且去異星旅行兼收拾自己的爛攤子。
i want to have sex with the headcrabs

A classic. After trying to beat this game over the years as a kid, I finally decided to come back to it and finish the deed (mostly because I didn't want to start 2 without finishing this). I was not disappointed, this really is a great game and I'd say it's a must-play. I love learning about media that are considered classics, and this is definitely one of them.
Played when it first came out. I was in middle school and my computer could barely run the game. This game is the best FPS ever made.
Старая добрая классика. Дала начало многим играм, особенно огромнейшее разнообразие оружие, которые в дальнейшем добавляли разработчики не относящиеся к VALVE.

This game fuckin' made my childhood, this one game has been a big cornerstone in my life. It still plays well to this day, and the hundreds or maybe thousands of mods available mean you basically can get whatever you want from this game.

很小的时候玩cs1.6偶尔打开游戏根目录经常能看到一个λ的图标，点进去是弗里曼博士端着枪的菜单紧接着就是闪退，后来才是到这是半条命，便迷上了这款游戏。现在有幸来steam上为童年补票，这么多年过去了，游戏的画质越来越好，但是却很少有像半条命这样真正意义上的神作和这么好玩的游戏了。
神作永远是神作，粗糙的画质掩盖不了它优秀的本质。

Her oyuncunun deneyimlemesi gereken bir oyun olduğunu düşünüyorum.Kesinlikle dünya tarihinin en iyi oyunlarından biri. 98'de çıkan bir oyuna göre zamanının çok ötesinde,zaten oyun sektörünün bu kadar gelişmesini bu oyuna borçlu sayılırız.
Dediğim gibi arkadaşlar mutlaka oynayın oynattırın ha ben eski grafiklerden oynayamam diyorsanız gidin black mesa oynayın ama oynayın aga. 10/10

Nearly a decade and a half ago, I overheard my cousin talking something about shooting terrorists on a video game. That is the exact moment I got hooked on Half-Life because computers were already fascinating to me, let alone playing adrenaline inducing games (for the time at least half life was adrenaline inducing lol) I had a very hard time imagining how much entertaining it would be to engage in shootouts with terrorists in virtual world. That was the Half-Life demo, I think, where you constantly kill terrorists until you see G-Man watching you from on top of a scaffolding. Anyway, we were playing as if there was no other thing to do in this world. Recently, I got into it again and finished the storyline for the first time. It was entertaining and enlightening at the same time, because when you were playing the demo, you wouldn't know what the hell is going on; the game is just another hack/slash for you, not any different than DOOM. The story is, how can I say, legendary. A straight ten. At least from my perspective because I love the abandoned laboratory concept a lot. Being as objective as possible, you may see a lot of flaws but there are things that should be taken into consideration before becoming way too judgemental about it. First things first; the game is fucking 23 years old. This simple fact is enough to start praising this game. Anyway, my point is that when it's half-life; you don't take its age into consideration. It's like GTAV where the game is older than most industry-leading games nowadays but it doesn't stop it from being better than them in most of the aspects. To compare Cyberpunk 2077 and GTAV would suffice to support my take. Long story short, depending on when you play it, it's a life changing experience or a duty to play. Duty, because this is undoubtedly a classic. You should definitely play it if you haven't already. What are you waiting for?
Fantastic game with great weapon selection and the crossfire map is just fantastic fun. I played during my post graduate in college and we all played in the Astrophysics team .

This game is really really good. The combat is just exquisite and the atmosphere is top notch. I really did not expect that much out of this, but it is definitely one of the best shooters I have ever played. Personally I think the combat and pacing here is much better than Half-Life 2.

primeiro da valve começando bem, dahorão

One of the greatest shooters ever made, the gunplay is so fluid yet methodical, I don’t mean to sound pretentious but it’s a thinking man’s shooter. You have to plan out your reaction to each encounter (sometimes on the fly) and figure out what strategies work and which ones don’t making it a really rewarding experience. The graphics are outdated for sure, but with a level of creativity to it which alleviates the major gripes of it. If you still don’t like it go play black mesa it’s just as good. 10/10
Its the best game   i have played and also this is the game that made me into playing vavle game's

Interação incrível, até para os dias de hoje. Sem cutscenes, sendo tudo no controle do player.. História complexa, e muito boa. Personagens marcantes.. Gameplay ótima sendo simples e boa, a partes tensas e até algumas que da medo, sendo uma ótima combinação de parkour, combate, puzzle e terror!

[h1]Revolutionising the landscape doesn't suddenly make this game a masterpiece[/h1]

[b]Masterpiece:[/b] a work of outstanding artistry, skill, or workmanship.

Half-Life is not a masterpiece. It's not a bad game, however it is not particularly good either. Nostalgists won't hesitate to tell you that this game is what shaped the modern FPS landscape, as if that suddenly means we should ignore the shortcomings just because it did something different.

I started off this franchise by playing HL2, and I really want to try Black Mesa, but I decided I would have to play the original first for the full experience, and oh boy what a mistake. I have heard that Black Mesa is very faithful to the original, so apart from graphics I have a feeling it is going to annoy me just as much.

Let's talk about what this game did well:
[list]
[*]As a Half-Life game the world is engaging and it is easy to follow the story.
[*]Wide variety of weapons
[*]That's it... Nothing else really wowed me.
[/list]

Let's talk about what missed the mark:
[list]
[*]Infrequent auto saves. Maybe I am just so used to HL2, Halo, CoD, etc. but the auto saves seemed to set me back up to 10 mins of progress, which was beyond frustrating. One small mistake (jump, 1 hit kill enemy, or even put in a situation where my health is just too low for me to survive) is all it took and yet it would send you back so far to the point where it made seemingly simple things tedious.
[*]Trip mines are stupid it's easier to just headshot a soldier with a revolver than to try and strategically place these. Soldiers also seem to see through walls as they will be very aggressive if you suddenly don't have a gun in your hands, so they will charge you and you will lose health trying to switch back.
[*] Getting lost or really stupid paths. No this isn't a complaint about "On the rail" (albeit I do have complaints about that chapter). I have played HL2, and had no issue finding my way there, but I found myself getting lost over and over, I don't know if it is the dated graphics making the lack of detail cause everything to look similar or if the devs just didn't make it clearer where you were supposed to go. I frequently found myself consulting a YT walkthrough to find out where I am supposed to go.
[*]"On the rail" is an experience, but controlling that machine with the same controls you use to move was awful. I frequently ran into traps because I kept moving when i tried to slow down or I accidentally released control of the mechanism causing me to just walk off. The chapter is actually very linear, and yet I found that jumping off the machine and just walking made it redundant and 10x easier, so not sure why it existed in the first place, because jumping off and walking skips entire sections.
[*]The game doesn't even tell you the controls anywhere. I had to find out how to long jump using Google. Thankfully as I had played HL2 most of the other controls were easy to figure out, but someone new to the game would likely be very annoyed and frustrated to have to consult options every few seconds. Also why doesn't the weapon selection menu go away if you choose not to change weapon? You have to press M1 to make it go away, so this meant I might cycle through, change my mind and unlike HL2 it would stay there making me waste time switching back to the weapon I was using.
[*]The shotgun sucks even at point blank. I guess this is to balance the ridiculous amount of reserve ammo you get, but I found myself using the revolver and crossbow for 90% of the game (once acquired) because I could just kill everything in 1-2 hits (normal difficulty). Whenever I used the shotgun it just didn't pack a punch even at point blank, and even with the alt-fire. HL2 handled this gun much better.
[*]The Assassins are so unbalanced. You will kill them, but your HP will be so low by the end of it, that you will just die as soon as you hit the next section. It's so annoying to simultaneously handle an enemy that dodges so efficiently while also being very aggressive.
[/list]

Neutral Points:
[list]
[*]Graphics are okay, nothing that will blow your mind
[*]Enemy design is tolerable given the era. You have your basic monsters, zombies, soldiers and 1 hit hazards, I can imagine that because of how focused Valve were on world building that these enemies would be considered "meh" in that time period.
[/list]

[b][u]Overall:[/u][/b]
You got this in "The Valve Complete Pack" just like I did. Put this in your "hidden" list and forget it exists, just not worth the effort. Read a short synopsis if you care to know the details of what happened that badly.

Edit:
I forgot to mention my absolute top pet peeve, doors in this game require you to WALK INTO THEM, yes unlike any normal game you don't press the "use" key you just walk into them. This is such a small detail and yet it drastically affects so much.

Edit 2:
Thanks for free Steam points! If your solution to getting triggered by my review, instead of taking criticism like an adult, is to reward me then I ain't conplaining!
